search.query: | stats sum(lansweeper_last_event) as field_lansweeper, sum(qualys_last_event) as field_qualys, sum(tenable_last_event) as field_tenable, sum(sophos_last_event) as field_sophos, sum(defender_last_event) as field_defender, sum(crowdstrike_last_event) as field_crowdstrike,sum(kaspersky_last_event) as field_kaspersky | eval field_lansweeper=if(field_lansweeper>0, ", lansweeper", ""), field_qualys=if(field_qualys>0, ", qualys", ""), field_tenable=if(field_tenable>0, ", tenable", ""), field_sophos=if(field_sophos>0, ", sophos", ""), field_defender=if(field_defender>0, ", defender", ""), field_crowdstrike=if(field_crowdstrike>0, ", crowdstrike", ""), field_kaspersky=if(field_kaspersky>0, ", kaspersky", "")

| inputlookup cs_device_inventory | stats count as Total, sum(eval(if(isnotnull(lansweeper_id) and lansweeper_id!="", 1, 0))) as Lansweeper, sum(eval(if(isnotnull(qualys_id) and qualys_id!="", 1, 0))) as Qualys, sum(eval(if(isnotnull(tenable_uuid) and tenable_uuid!="", 1, 0))) as Tenable, sum(eval(if(isnotnull(windows_defender_host) and windows_defender_host!="", 1, 0))) as Defender, sum(eval(if((isnotnull(sophos_uuid) and sophos_uuid!=""), 1, 0))) as Sophos, sum(eval(if(isnotnull(crowdstrike_userid) and crowdstrike_userid!="", 1, 0))) as CrowdStrike, sum(eval(if(isnotnull(kaspersky_host) and kaspersky_host!="", 1, 0))) as Kaspersky, sum(eval(if(((isnotnull(lansweeper_id) and lansweeper_id!="") AND ((isnotnull(qualys_id) and qualys_id!="") OR (isnotnull(tenable_uuid) and tenable_uuid!="")) AND ((isnotnull(windows_defender_host) and windows_defender_host!="") OR (isnotnull(sophos_uuid) and sophos_uuid!="") OR (isnotnull(crowdstrike_userid) and crowdstrike_userid!="") OR (isnotnull(kaspersky_host) and kaspersky_host!=""))), 1, 0))) as All, sum(eval(if(((isnotnull(qualys_id) and qualys_id!="") OR (isnotnull(tenable_uuid) and tenable_uuid!="")), 1, 0))) as Vulnerability_Scanner, sum(eval(if(((isnotnull(windows_defender_host) and windows_defender_host!="") OR (isnotnull(sophos_uuid) and sophos_uuid!="") OR (isnotnull(crowdstrike_userid) and crowdstrike_userid!="")OR (isnotnull(kaspersky_host) and kaspersky_host!="")), 1, 0))) as Antivirus | eval No_Lansweeper=Total-Lansweeper, No_Qualys=Total-Qualys, No_Tenable=Total-Tenable, No_Sophos=Total-Sophos, No_Defender=Total-Defender, No_CrowdStrike=Total-CrowdStrike, No_Kaspersky=Total-Kaspersky, No_Antivirus=Total-Antivirus, No_Vulnerability_Scanner=Total-Vulnerability_Scanner

html.p: Device Inventory generator report needs to be enabled.

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/cyences_app_for_splunk/saved/searches count=0 splunk_server=local | search "eai:acl.app"="cyences_app_for_splunk" title IN ("Device Inventory - Lansweeper", "Device Inventory - Tenable", "Device Inventory - Tenable Vuln", "Device Inventory - Qualys", "Device Inventory - Sophos", "Device Inventory - Windows Defender", "Device Inventory - CrowdStrike", "Device Inventory - Kaspersky", "Device Inventory Gen", "Device Inventory Temp Lookup CleanUp", "Device Inventory Lookup CleanUp") | table title, disabled | rename title as label | eval status=if(disabled=1, "Report is disabled", "Report is enabled") | table label, status

format.colorPalette: {"Data Present": #03991a, "Data Not Present": #a3030b, "Report is enabled": #03991a, "Report is disabled": #a3030b}

html.p: If you are looking at the Device Inventory for the first time and you don't see all the available devices in the table below then you can manually execute Device Inventory Backfill report to fill all the lookups. (By default it runs over last 30 days of time to collect the device inventory.)
Description: The total amount of devices detected.
Note - Click on any of the surrounding bar charts to view more information about specific devices in the Device Inventory. Click on the number above to reset the filter.

chart.title: Number of Devices That Are Connected To A Specific Security Component

search.query: | table Total, Lansweeper, Qualys, Tenable, Sophos, Defender, CrowdStrike, Kaspersky

html.p: Description: The total amount of devices that are connected to a particular security component.

chart.title: Number of Devices That Contain A Specific Security Component

search.query: | table Total, All, Lansweeper, Vulnerability_Scanner, Antivirus

condition.set: ((lansweeper_last_event=*) AND (tenable_last_event=* OR qualys_last_event=*) AND (sophos_last_event=* OR defender_last_event=* OR crowdstrike_last_event=* OR kaspersky_last_event=*))
(sophos_last_event=* OR defender_last_event=* OR crowdstrike_last_event=* OR kaspersky_last_event=*)

html.p: Description: Each bar represents the total number of devices that are connected to a particular security component. The Lansweeper bar displays the number of devices that have Lansweeper. The Vulnerability Scanner bar displays the number of devices that have either Qualys or Tenable. The Antivirus bar displays the number of devices that have CrowdStrike, Kaspersky, Defender, or Sophos.

chart.title: Number of Devices That Lack A Specific Security Component

condition.set: NOT (sophos_last_event=* OR defender_last_event=* OR crowdstrike_last_event=* OR kaspersky_last_event=*)

html.p: Description: Each bar represents the total number of devices that lack a particular security component. The Lansweeper bar displays the number of devices where Lansweeper is absent. The Vulnerability Scanner displays the number of devices where Qualys or Tenable are absent. The Antivirus bar displays the number of devices that lack the following antivirus software: CrowdStrike, Kaspersky, Defender, and Sophos.
You can use IP subnet mask search for IP, like 10.1.1.0/24 or you can also use a wildcard (*) can be used to search IP Address range like: 10.1.1.*
A wildcard (*) is added by default at the front and end of Host, User and Mac Address filters.

search.query: search $tkn_sp_filter$ | table uuid, hostname, ip, mac_address, os, user $tkn_tablefields_lansweeper$ $tkn_tablefields_qualys$ $tkn_tablefields_tenable$, active_vul, high_vul $tkn_tablefields_sophos$ $tkn_tablefields_defender$ $tkn_tablefields_crowdstrike$ $tkn_tablefields_kaspersky$ tmp_* ip_drilldown hostname_drilldown user_drilldown | search $tkn_host$ $tkn_ip$ $tkn_user$ $tkn_mac$

table.fields: uuid, hostname, ip, mac_address, os, user $tkn_tablefields_lansweeper$ $tkn_tablefields_qualys$ $tkn_tablefields_tenable$, active_vul, high_vul $tkn_tablefields_sophos$ $tkn_tablefields_defender$ $tkn_tablefields_crowdstrike$ $tkn_tablefields_kaspersky$

html.p: If a hyphen(-) appears in the table that means data isn't present for that specific category.
The Device Inventory will automatically hide columns for devices that lack a certain type of data.

ul.li: Green = No active vulnerabilities (Info level is not considered)
Green = No active vulnerabilities (Info level is not considered)

html.p: active_vul: Informational vulnerabilities are excluded from the active_vuln count.
high_vul: Severity 5 and severity 4 active vulnerabilities count.

panel.title: Possible Merge UUIDs (Devices) in Device Inventory

search.query: | inputlookup cs_device_inventory | eval ip_all=ip, mac_address_all=mac_address | eval ip_all=mvjoin(ip, ","), mac_address_all=mvjoin(mac_address, ",") | multireport [ | stats values(*) as * by mac_address | where isnotnull(mac_address) AND mac_address!="" AND mac_address!=" " | eval no_uuids=mvcount(uuid) | where no_uuids>1 | eval first_part_of_mac=tonumber(substr(mac_address, 0, 2)) | eval power=mvrange(0,8) | mvexpand power | eval base2=pow(2, power) | eval mydiv=floor(first_part_of_mac/base2) | eval mybin=mydiv % 2 | stats list(mybin) as binary, values(*) as * by mac_address | eval second_bit_in_mac_binary=mvindex(binary,1) | where second_bit_in_mac_binary=0 | eval Type="Mac Address Matches", ip="" | table Type, mac_address, uuid, no_uuids, hostname, ip_all, mac_address_all, lansweeper_id, qualys_id, tenable_uuid, sophos_uuid, windows_defender_host, crowdstrike_userid, kaspersky_host] [ | stats values(*) as * by ip | where isnotnull(ip) AND ip!="" AND ip!=" " | eval no_uuids=mvcount(uuid) | where no_uuids>1 | eval Type="IP Matches", mac_address="" | table Type, ip, uuid, no_uuids, hostname, ip_all, mac_address_all, lansweeper_id, qualys_id, tenable_uuid, sophos_uuid, windows_defender_host, crowdstrike_userid, kaspersky_host] | table Type, ip, mac_address, uuid, no_uuids, hostname, ip_all, mac_address_all, lansweeper_id, qualys_id, tenable_uuid, sophos_uuid, windows_defender_host, crowdstrike_userid, kaspersky_host | sort - no_uuids

panel.title: Product Device ID Conflicts Auto Merged

search.query: index=_internal sourcetype="cyences:logs" CASE(INFO) "is already present, while adding record" | rex "\'uuid\':\s'(?<uuid>[^\']+)\'" | rex " - data_pointer\[(?<product>[^\]]+)\]=(?<product_id_1>.*)\sis already present" | rex "\(\'lansweeper_id\', \'(?<product_id_2_lansweeper>[^\']+)\'\)" | rex "\(\'tenable_uuid\', \'(?<product_id_2_tenable>[^\']+)\'\)" | rex "\(\'qualys_id\', \'(?<product_id_2_qualys>[^\']+)\'\)" | rex "\(\'sophos_uuid\', \'(?<product_id_2_sophos>[^\']+)\'\)" | rex "\(\'windows_defender_host\', \'(?<product_id_2_windows_defender>[^\']+)\'\)" | rex "\(\'crowdstrike_userid\', \'(?<product_id_2_crowdstrike>[^\']+)\'\) | rex "\(\'kaspersky_host\', \'(?<product_id_2_kaspersky>[^\']+)\'\)" | eval product_id_2=case(product=="lansweeper_id", product_id_2_lansweeper, product=="tenable_uuid", product_id_2_tenable, product=="qualys_id", product_id_2_qualys, product=="sophos_uuid", product_id_2_sophos, product=="windows_defender_host", product_id_2_windows_defender, product=="crowstrike_userid", product_id_2_crowdsrike) | rex "\(\'hostname\', \[(?<hostname1>[^\]]+)\]\)" | rex "\(\'ip\', \[(?<ip1>[^\]]+)\]\)" | rex "\(\'mac_address\', \[(?<mac_address1>[^\]]+)\]\)" | rex "\'hostname\': \[(?<hostname2>[^\]]+)\]" | rex "\'ip\': \[(?<ip2>[^\]]+)\]" | rex "\'mac_address\': \[(?<mac_address2>[^\]]+)\]" | rex "entry:{(?<lookup_entry>[^}]+)}" | table uuid, product, product_id_1, product_id_2, hostname1, hostname2, ip1, ip2, mac_address1, mac_address2, lookup_entry
